text: Changing your Twitch username
can be done via a web browser
or using the Twitch app on your phone.
But we suggest going through this process

on a web browser as a
more reliable option,

and this is the process
we will be showing today.
In your web browser, go to Twitch.tv

and log in to the account
you want to make changes to.
In the top right, click on your user icon.
Then go down and click on "Settings."
Then scroll down to "Profile Settings."

Here you can see "Username"
and "Display Name."
The display name will always
match the username spelling-wise,

but the display name
is where you can adjust
the capitalization of certain letters.

So if you want to change
your unique Twitch name

to something entirely
different than it is now,
you need to adjust the username.

Then you can adjust
the display name after,

using the capitalization
style of your choice.
Click the pen tool next to the username
to begin the changing process.

Here it lets you know
that changes are immediate

and you can only change
the username every 60 days.

Also, your current username
will be held by Twitch
for six months before being released
back into the availability pool.

To proceed with the
username-changing process,

begin typing a new name
in the username box.

Twitch will let you know
if it's available or not.

For this example, since
it's not 2020 anymore,

I want to update my
username to insiderguy2021.

Once you have typed your
new username in the box
and it's available, click "Update."
Your username has now changed,
but let's change the display name
to match our capitalization style we want.
Adjust the username capitalization
inside the "Display Name" box
without changing the spelling of the name,
then click "Save Changes."
